summary: Brand rename to “PDF Vaulty” is partially implemented (document title and header brand/alt updated). However, at least one English i18n string still references the old branding (“PDF toolkit”), and several unrelated UI/monetization-style changes (footer ad spaces/UTM link) appear in the diff without being requested.

missing_requirements.requirement: Remove/replace all remaining user-facing English UI strings that still reference the old app name/branding (PDF Toolkit) with “PDF Vaulty”.
missing_requirements.reason: An English home CTA subtitle still contains “PDF toolkit”, which is user-facing and conflicts with the acceptance criterion that no remaining UI strings display the old name/branding.
evidence: frontend/src/i18n/translations.ts (en: 'home.cta.subtitle': 'Join thousands of users who trust our PDF toolkit')

missing_requirements.requirement: Update English i18n translation strings that contain the old app name “PDF Toolkit” to “PDF Vaulty” while preserving keys.
missing_requirements.reason: The English translation content still contains the old branding word “PDF toolkit” within an i18n-provided string; it should be updated while keeping the same translation key.
evidence: frontend/src/i18n/translations.ts (en: 'home.cta.subtitle': 'Join thousands of users who trust our PDF toolkit')

hallucinated_features.description: Footer monetization/advertisement placeholders (three ad spaces) and a UTM-tracked caffeine.ai attribution link.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest is strictly about renaming branding strings to “PDF Vaulty” and explicitly states no changes to PDF tool functionality or other unrelated behavior; adding ad placements/UTM attribution is not requested.
evidence: frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx (three “Ad Space” blocks; caffeine.ai link with UTM params; appIdentifier logic)

hallucinated_features.description: Project metadata/state updates indicating app-store/in-app displayed name desires and new AR items.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not request modifying project tracking/state files; these changes are outside the specified frontend branding rename work.
